title_full: HCISEC01-BP01 Identify where health data is in your environment
title: Identify where health data is in your environment
description: Determine applicable regulatory frameworks and controls as it pertains to data classification. Create and document a data classification strategy. Select the appropriate cloud deployment model according to your specific needs, the type of data you handle, and the assessed risk. Implement automated data classification using services like Amazon Macie and Amazon Comprehend Medical.
outcome: Organizations understand what types of health data are being hosted and processed, and where that data resides, ensuring the right controls are in place for aligning with relevant regulatory frameworks and standards.

title_full: HCISEC01-BP02 Implement least privilege access to health data
title: Implement least privilege access to health data
description: Use identity and access management to control access to systems, resources, and data. Limit access to health data to only people or systems who require the access to perform specific tasks. Use IAM to control who is authenticated and authorized to use services and resources. For data stores, use a combination of IAM permissions and service-specific authorization methods to secure stored health data.
outcome: Access to health data is limited to the minimum required, reducing risk of unauthorized access or data breaches while maintaining operational efficiency.

title_full: HCISEC02-BP01 Log access to health data
title: Log access to health data
description: Log access to systems, resources, and data in accordance with your policies and procedures. Implement and maintain logging of access to health data in accordance with regulatory frameworks applicable to your workload. Configure audit logs to be centralized and immutable to verify their integrity in the event of a forensic requirement.
outcome: Comprehensive audit trails provide evidence that proper people and systems are accessing health data, and support security incident investigations while meeting regulatory compliance requirements.

title: Review audit logs regularly
description: Create, document, and follow a policy and procedure to regularly review audit logs. Implement systems and procedures to review audit logs on a regular basis. Automate alerts for potential anomalies detected in logs using services like CloudWatch alarms, Amazon OpenSearch Service, and CloudTrail Insights.
outcome: Regular review of audit logs combined with automated anomaly detection enables early identification of security incidents and compliance violations, supporting continuous monitoring requirements.

title: Protect critical systems
description: Implement security controls necessary to protect the infrastructure within the AWS account. For migrated healthcare workloads with dependencies on older technologies, limit network access to sensitive hosts, apply the latest security patches, and employ monitoring practices. Enable Amazon GuardDuty in accounts that host and process PHI to add intelligent threat detection.
outcome: Critical healthcare systems are protected with appropriate network controls, patching, and threat detection, reducing the attack surface and improving security posture.

title_full: HCISEC04-BP01 Determine and enforce data residency requirements
title: Determine and enforce data residency requirements
description: Determine applicable regulatory frameworks and controls as it pertains to data locality. Enforce data locality requirements by implementing controls such as service control policies (SCPs) to limit access to specific AWS Regions. AWS will not move your content without your consent, except as legally required.
outcome: Health data is stored and processed only in approved geographic locations, meeting regulatory requirements for data residency and sovereignty.

title_full: HCISEC04-BP02 Protect health data at rest and in transit
title: Protect health data at rest and in transit
description: Encrypt sensitive health data at rest and in transit at all times. Implement encryption controls as part of the infrastructure architecture using infrastructure as code. Configure services to require encrypted connections and use AWS KMS for key management. The AWS Business Associate Addendum (BAA) requires encryption of PHI as defined by HIPAA at rest and in transit.
outcome: All sensitive health data is protected through encryption, meeting HIPAA and other regulatory requirements while preventing unauthorized access to data.

title: Isolate sensitive data
description: Isolate health data from non-health data by using multiple AWS accounts and designating specific accounts as containing health data. Use resource isolation such as designated Amazon S3 buckets to separate health data from non-health data. Limit access to health data within an account using tagging and conditional statements in IAM policies.
outcome: Health data is segregated from other data, simplifying the application of appropriate security controls and helping achieve least privilege access to sensitive information.

title_full: HCISEC05-BP01 Implement disaster recovery for critical systems
title: Implement disaster recovery for critical systems
description: Mitigate and respond to potential incidents by creating policies, procedures, and playbooks. Create specific policies, procedures, and playbooks for ransomware to prepare your organization. Implement a data availability strategy such as backups stored in a separate AWS account with authorization controls or a pilot light disaster recovery environment.
outcome: Organizations are prepared to respond to and recover from security incidents and natural disasters, minimizing impact on healthcare operations and patient care.
